author: cnbc.com
title: Daily Journal posts 1Q profit
text:
LOS ANGELES (AP) _ Daily Journal Corp. (DJCO) on Thursday reported fiscal first-quarter net income of $14.7 million, after reporting a loss in the same period a year earlier.
The Los Angeles-based company said it had net income of $10.67 per share. Losses, adjusted for pretax gains, came to $1.53 per share.
The newspaper publisher posted revenue of $10.3 million in the period.
Daily Journal shares have declined slightly more than 2 percent since the beginning of the year. The stock has climbed almost 4 percent in the last 12 months.
